Home → Recommendations & reviews → Fiction → New fiction for May 2015

New fiction for May 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published May 1, 2015

A god in ruins by Kate Atkinson

Described as a companion piece to her novel Life After Life, this book presents Teddy’s life in the 20th century as a non-linear narrative.

The Samaritan by Mason Cross

LAPD Detective Jessica Allen is on the trail of a serial killer who preys on lone female drivers who have broken down on the road.

The green road by Anne Enright

Family saga from the winner of the 2007 Man Booker Prize.

In my house by Alex Hourston

Margaret Benson becomes a hero after saving a teenage girl from human trafficking. However, the media publicity turns dark as Margaret receives mysterious phone calls.

The silent ones by Ali Knight

Darren Evans gets a job as a cleaner in the psychiatric hospital where his sister’s murderer is held. He’s looking for answers, but trying to play a serial killer is a dangerous game.

Sidney Chambers and the forgiveness of sins by James Runcie

More sleuthing from the Cambridge based priest and part-time detective, Canon Sidney Chambers. Also available as an eBook from our OverDrive service.

Brides of War by June Tate (eBook)

Just after the Second World War, Gracie Brown emigrates to America with her husband Jeff. The couple move in with Jeff’s parents whilst they attempt to build their new lives.

The Devilish Mr Danvers by Vivienne Lorret (eBook)

In the second instalment of The Rakes of Fallow Hall, Rafe Danvers plans to marry off Hedley Sinclair in order to rid her from the hall, Greyson Park. However, things get complicated when he falls for her.

Brandon King

I work in the Suffolk Libraries Stock Team
